intro: Radermachera quadripinnata subsp. acuminata, commonly known as the glossy-leafed radermachera, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, including parts of Thailand and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped, and glossy dark green leaves. It produces small, white flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by small, round berries. This species is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and relatively easy care requirements.
